documents.title: turtle dove extinction warning
text: worcestershire wildlife trust is warning turtle doves could become extinct in the county .

it 's conservation officer steve bloomfield says the uk turtle dove population declined by 97 % between 1970 and 2013 and there are areas in the the north of the county where they have already disappeared .
the group believes habitat loss and herbicides have had a significant impact on their life expectancy .

documents.title: satellites could ease worcestershire traffic
text: worcestershire highways is looking at deploying satellite technology to monitor congestion around the county .
it 's held talks with a manufacturer that supplies micro-satellite ( or cubesat ) technology to predict flooding events with the idea of using it to fill gaps in real-time congestion data .
there are also plans to link it to a commercially sponsored phone app , which would also allow users to share travel information .

documents.title: cancer benefits refusal 'not unusual '
text: a cancer support group says a worcestershire woman 's situation of being refused benefits despite being too ill to work is not unusual .
shelly , who 's 46 and is too embarrassed to use her full name , says she ca n't afford to eat and is relying on donations from the droitwich food bank .

documents.title: police investigate 'bogus charity ' collectors
text: police are asking people in worcester to contact them with information about `` bogus charity collectors '' .
the force is investigating a number of reports of fraudulent collections in the st john 's and bedwardine areas .

insp gerry smith said : `` we are investigating these matters , although i want to stress that we are keeping an open mind and there is currently no evidence that any offences have been committed . ''

documents.title: apology for disabled woman 'sleeping on floor '
text: a housing association 's apologised to a disabled herefordshire woman , who 's sleeping on her living room floor because of delays in finding her an adapted bungalow .
gail wyatt and her husband nigel were told a suitable home was available , but the offer was later withdrawn .

she 's also on the local authority 's accessible housing register , who are trying to get her a property before christmas ; but unfortunately we ca n't guarantee when the couple are able to be housed .

documents.title: plea to save bewdley 's last bank
text: the labour party in bewdley has written an open letter to hsbc to try to persuade them not to close the only bank left in the town .
the letter says the company has a `` moral obligation '' , as the last bank standing , to the local residents and businesses .
the party asked to see a breakdown of the footfall statistics behind hsbc 's plan to close .

documents.title: worcestershire 's 'longest serving ' lollipop lady
text: a pensioner 's been named the longest serving lollipop lady in worcestershire by the county council after almost 40 years of service .
jill edwards got the job on the ombersley road in worcester in 1976 after her son asked her to stop walking him to school .
she 's helped five generations of children from the northwick manor primary get to school safely .
author: Felicity Sanderson
Journalist

documents.title: breast cancer woman using food bank after saying she 's been refused benefits
text: a worcestershire woman with breast cancer says she ca n't afford to feed her family as she 's been refused benefits , despite not being able to work .
46-year-old shelly is using the foodbank in droitwich to support herself , her five children and her husband , who 's in full-time work .
she does n't want to use her full name as she says she 's `` embarrassed '' at having to rely on donations .
shelly 's mp nigel huddleston says he has been looking into this for her and he 's asked the complaints team to look into her case .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: disabled woman claims she is sleeping on floor after housing offer withdrawn
text: a disabled woman says she 's sleeping on her living room floor after herefordshire housing withdrew an offer for her to move to a two-bedroom bungalow .
gail wyatt and her husband nigel had already packed up their bed and furniture when they were told the property was n't suitable for her wheelchair .
gail , who had a stroke in 2000 , says the stress has already affected her physical and mental health .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester
